verse.roman:
pañcāśīti sahasrāṇi
hy avyāhata-balaḥ samāḥ
anaṣṭa-vitta-smaraṇo
bubhuje 'kṣayya-ṣaḍ-vasu

synonyms: pañcāśīti—eighty-five; sahasrāṇi—thousands; hi—indeed; avyāhata—inexhaustible; balaḥ—the strength of whom; samāḥ—years; anaṣṭa—without deterioration; vitta—material opulences; smaraṇaḥ—and memory; bubhuje—enjoyed; akṣayya—without deterioration; ṣaṭ-vasu—six kinds of enjoyable material opulence.
translation: For eighty-five thousand years, Kārtavīryārjuna continuously enjoyed material opulences with full bodily strength and unimpaired memory. In other words, he enjoyed inexhaustible material opulences with his six senses.
